DataElement.preferredName: Acute Leukemia of Ambiguous Lineage Initial Presentation Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents whether a patient was diagnosed at initial leukemia presentation or only at relapse after an initial leukemia presentation that was not Acute Leukemia of Ambiguous Lineage (ALAL).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Acute Leukemia of Ambiguous Lineage Presentation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An acute leukemia in which the blasts lack sufficient evidence to classify as myeloid or lymphoid or they have morphologic and/or immunophenotypic characteristics of both myeloid and lymphoid cells. (WHO, 2001)_To show or display; the act of presenting something to sight or view: how something looks.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An acute leukemia in which the blasts lack sufficient evidence to classify as myeloid or lymphoid or they have morphologic and/or immunophenotypic characteristics of both myeloid and lymphoid cells.  The prognosis is usually unfavorable.  (WHO, 2001) -- 2003

Concepts.definition: An acute leukemia in which the blasts lack sufficient evidence to classify as myeloid or lymphoid or they have morphologic and/or immunophenotypic characteristics of both myeloid and lymphoid cells. (WHO, 2001)

Property.preferredDefinition: To show or display; the act of presenting something to sight or view: how something looks.

Concepts.definition: To show or display; the act of presenting something to sight or view: how something looks.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: TARGET:Therapeutically Applicable Research to Generate Effective Treatments

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
